docs.abstract: The Senate majority leader has encouraged judges thinking about stepping down to do so soon to ensure that Republicans confirm their replacements this year.
docs.snippet: The Senate majority leader has encouraged judges thinking about stepping down to do so soon to ensure that Republicans confirm their replacements this year.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Running out of federal court vacancies to fill, Senate Republicans have been quietly making overtures to sitting Republican-nominated judges who are eligible to retire to urge them to step aside so they can be replaced while the party still holds the Senate and the White House.

headline.main: McConnell Has a Request for Veteran Federal Judges: Please Quit
headline.print_headline: McConnell’s Pitch to Veteran Judges: Please Quit

docs.abstract: President Trump has delegated the authority to invoke extraordinary powers over private industry, but his administration does not seem to be using it yet.
docs.snippet: President Trump has delegated the authority to invoke extraordinary powers over private industry, but his administration does not seem to be using it yet.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump issued an executive order this week invoking the Defense Production Act to battle the coronavirus pandemic, but his advisers have resisted making aggressive use of the law to mobilize private industry.

headline.main: How the Defense Production Act Could Yield More Masks, Ventilators and Tests

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

docs.abstract: Amer Fakhoury had been held in Beirut on decades-old charges. Separately, Michael R. White, a U.S. Navy veteran and cancer patient, was released from an Iranian prison.
docs.snippet: Amer Fakhoury had been held in Beirut on decades-old charges. Separately, Michael R. White, a U.S. Navy veteran and cancer patient, was released from an Iranian prison.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration on Thursday announced the release of two Americans imprisoned overseas and said it had intensified demands for a third, amid global fears that the coronavirus could quickly spread among detainees and result in deaths.

headline.main: Americans Held Overseas in Iran and Lebanon Are Freed
headline.print_headline: Americans Held in Iran And Lebanon Are Freed

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

byline.original: By Lara Jakes, Michael Crowley and Vivian Yee

docs.abstract: The president’s action will free up funds and lower legal barriers for responding to the pandemic.
docs.snippet: The president’s action will free up funds and lower legal barriers for responding to the pandemic.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Friday signed an emergency declaration over the coronavirus pandemic, unlocking certain government powers to deal with the public health challenge. Here’s a breakdown of what that means on a legal and practical level.

headline.main: Trump Declared an Emergency Over Coronavirus. Here’s What It Can Do.
headline.print_headline: What Does Declaration  From Trump  Actually Do?

docs.abstract: Amid increasing anxiety over the coronavirus, the president said he expected to pardon Michael T. Flynn, his former national security adviser who had pleaded guilty to lying to the F.B.I.
docs.snippet: Amid increasing anxiety over the coronavirus, the president said he expected to pardon Michael T. Flynn, his former national security adviser who had pleaded guilty to lying to the F.B.I.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As the country reeled from growing health and economic crises brought on by the spread of the coronavirus, President Trump announced on Sunday that he was “strongly considering” a pardon for his former national security adviser, Michael T. Flynn.

headline.main: Trump Says He’s ‘Strongly Considering’ Pardoning Flynn
headline.print_headline: As the Crisis Expands, Trump Is ‘Strongly Considering’ a Pardon for Flynn

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

byline.original: By Annie Karni and Adam Goldman

docs.abstract: The court said it would reschedule two weeks of arguments that had been set to start March 23, including major cases on President Trump’s financial records.
docs.snippet: The court said it would reschedule two weeks of arguments that had been set to start March 23, including major cases on President Trump’s financial records.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court announced Monday that it would postpone its next argument session “in keeping with public health precautions.”

headline.main: Supreme Court Postpones Arguments Over Coronavirus

docs.abstract: White House officials and lawmakers trying to bolster the economy during the coronavirus crisis don’t want to hear about any bailouts.
docs.snippet: White House officials and lawmakers trying to bolster the economy during the coronavirus crisis don’t want to hear about any bailouts.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When it comes to the term bailout, lawmakers and Trump administration officials would just as soon bail out and avoid it altogether. Same goes for stimulus; many don’t find the word politically stimulating at all. And don’t even dare to mention troubled assets.

headline.main: In Talking About Economic Recovery, Washington Shuns the B-Word
headline.print_headline: In Talk on Economic Recovery, Washington Chooses Its Words Warily

docs.abstract: For a while it continued to schedule new rallies. Now, one ally — Karl Rove — says canceling them will create “pent-up demand.”
docs.snippet: For a while it continued to schedule new rallies. Now, one ally — Karl Rove — says canceling them will create “pent-up demand.”
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — From its inception, the Trump campaign has viewed its role as amplifying whatever the president says. But that role has been complicated by the coronavirus.

headline.main: Trump’s Campaign Has Had to Adjust to His Changing View of the Coronavirus
headline.print_headline: Virus Alters Playbook, Forcing Trump Campaign Into a Series of Shifts

byline.original: By Annie Karni and Maggie Haberman

docs.abstract: Hours after Democrats blocked the nearly $2 trillion package, a marathon set of private negotiations appeared to have yielded important compromises.
docs.snippet: Hours after Democrats blocked the nearly $2 trillion package, a marathon set of private negotiations appeared to have yielded important compromises.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Treasury secretary and the top Senate Democrat said late Monday that they were on the brink of a deal on a nearly $2 trillion emergency economic aid measure to respond to the coronavirus pandemic, after a marathon day of talks as Democrats demanded stronger protections for workers and restrictions for bailed-out businesses.

headline.main: Top Senate Democrat and Treasury Secretary Say They Are Near a Stimulus Deal
headline.print_headline: Rancor Makes Stimulus Bill A Heavy Lift

byline.original: By Emily Cochrane and Nicholas Fandos

docs.abstract: Signs of a large-scale federal response to the coronavirus outbreak have begun to appear, generating praise from local officials but also pleas that they need much more.
docs.snippet: Signs of a large-scale federal response to the coronavirus outbreak have begun to appear, generating praise from local officials but also pleas that they need much more.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Federal emergency response teams toured a convention center in New York City on Monday, a sign that a much-needed temporary hospital is on the way. California has received hundreds of thousands of masks for those on the front lines of the outbreak. And President Trump said desperately needed protective equipment was on its way to Washington State.

headline.main: As Federal Government Mobilizes, Local Officials Say Response Remains Too Slow

byline.original: By Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Eric Lipton
